document.docAuthor: Nguyen, Tung T., Nguyen, Anh D., Tran, Binh T. T. & Blakemore, Robert J.
document.masterDocTitle: A comprehensive checklist of earthworm species and subspecies from Vietnam (Annelida: Clitellata: Oligochaeta: Almidae, Eudrilidae, Glossoscolecidae, Lumbricidae, Megascolecidae, Moniligastridae, Ocnerodrilidae, Octochaetidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A comprehensive checklist of earthworm species and subspecies from Vietnam (Annelida: Clitellata: Oligochaeta: Almidae, Eudrilidae, Glossoscolecidae, Lumbricidae, Megascolecidae, Moniligastridae, Ocnerodrilidae, Octochaetidae)

bibRefCitation.author: Perrier
bibRefCitation.refString: Perrier, E. (1872) Recherches pour servir a l'histoire des Lombriciens terrestres. Nouvelles Archives du Museum d'Histoire Naturelle de Paris, 8, 5 - 198.

subSubSection.paragraph: See Blakemore (2002) for more details and synonyms.
Examined material. 5 C, 5 A ( CTU-EW.003.01 ) Cho Moi, An Giang , 2/2010, coll. Ho Minh Thuan.

Distribution. Cosmopolitan species, widely distributed in Australia , New Zealand , Japan , Korea , China , USA , Canada , England , Samoa , India , Taiwan , Thailand , Myanmar , Malaysia , Indonesia , Philippines , Madagascar , Cambodia ( Gates 1972 ; Thai & Do 1989 ; Blakemore 20 12a).
Vietnamese name. Giun Quế, Trùn Quế.
Remarks. The species is commonly used in earthworm farms, and sold as "red earthworm" for fishing and other purposes in Vietnam .
